tournament_name: Bounce Milwaukee's Third Friday Tourney
details:
Join us on the third Friday of every month from 6-9 pm.
Winners will claim a custom trophy and a Stern translight or other prizes. We'll often have additional swag courtesy of Stern Pinball, Bounce Milwaukee or area breweries or distilleries.
We will usually rotate through the following pins: Godzilla, Deadpool, The Mandalorian, Avatar, Judge Dredd, Stargate, Starship Troopers, Star Wars EP1, Star Trek, Stern Star Wars, Demolition Man, Terminator 2, Spiderman and James Bond (and sometimes a few more or less)
This is an IFPA - International Flipper Pinball Association sanctioned tournament, and we will pay the IFPA fees for all players. Format will generally be 7 rounds of 7/5/3/1, but may vary some months.
This is an all-ages tournament; on nights that we have 3 or more players under 15, we'll have a separate ceremony and trophy for that age group, but under-15s can (and sometimes do!) place in the regular tourney as well.
There's no need (or way) to register in advance - just come on in!
This is also very open to new players - whether you're experienced or this is your first one, come on in and we'll show you the ropes. Thanks to our Tournament Director (and pinball tech) Nate Oines for organizing every month!
-------------
Machines are on free play, so you have a few options on how to enter:
$7 = Unlimited pinball (and arcade) games plus tournament entry
OR
Buy a Bounce or Everything wristband and the tournament entry will be included. You can come early and bounce, climb, laser tag, Magnetag, build forts, or play any of our pins or arcade games.
--------------
Other details:
-Kitchen, bar and venue open until 9pm.
During, before or after the tournament, check out the 50/50 tournament to benefit Project Pinball Charity!
We don't normally play extra balls , but will play them when there's a side tournament (like the Spider-Man 50/50 or machine-specific side-tourneys from Stern).

IFPA rules

Machines are on street rules, in other words, we plunge extra balls. Special tournament modes may be used and will be called out at machine assignment.

It is the players responsibility to make sure it is their turn before plunging the ball! If you play someone else's ball you get a DQ for that game. If you walk up to a machine and you can't tell who's turn it is, contact a TD (tournament director) to make the call.

All rulings must be made by a TD.

No abuse whatsoever is acceptable, be nice to each other and yourself and The Machines.

Nudging is allowed. Sliding, slapping or end of ball frustration abuse is strictly prohibited.

tournament_name: Stern Army - I/O Arcade Bar Monthly Tournament
details: This is a monthly public tournament occurs the fourth Wednesday of every month. In person registration opens at 6:30pm. There is no limit on participants. We play 2.5 hours of qualifying four-player MatchPlay groups across 21 machines. This is a minimum of 5 qualifying rounds and a maximum of 6 qualifying rounds. Along the way we give out prizes from our sponsors based on hi/lo scores, last place finishes and the occasional random throw of the dice. The top four contestants play 8 rounds of PAPA style group match play to determine the top four ranking.

tournament_name: Flip Frenzy at Pinball Land
details:
Join in the fun at Pinball Land's weekly Flip Frenzy pinball tournaments! 
Our casual, fun-focused tournaments are a blast for new and experienced players alike as we compete for the Championship Belt.
The tournament starts at 7:00 PM sharp every Wednesday night. Arrive as early as 6:00 PM to register and warm up.
Admission is just $15 and includes tournament entry, pizza, pop, and all the pinball you can handle until 10:00 PM.
No pre-registration - just come on in! Tournament is capped at 35 players.

tournament_name: North End Pub Target Matchplay Series
details: The 4th Thursday of most months we will have either a Timed or Target Matchplay tournament! The tournament will start at 8:30 PM on the scheduled dates. Anyone is welcome to play, no entry fee, just need quarters for coin drop!

tournament_name: RLM Amusements Weekly Pinball Tournament
details:
RLM Amusements hosts a Max Matchplay pinball tournament every Thursday night! The tournament is open to all ages and all skill levels. The entry fee is $10 and all the games are on free play. The doors open at 5pm for practice and the tournament starts at 7pm. Top 8/12/16 players (depending on how many people show up) face off in the finals. Feel free to bring any food or drinks you may want. We have a refrigerator, freezer and microwave available.

RLM Amusements is located at 4318 Plainfield Ave NE Suite K Grand Rapids, MI 49525. We are in the back of the building directly behind H&R Block. Plenty of off street parking available. Hope to see you here!

tournament_name: Stern Army
details:
How it Works
• Pinball tournament to be held on the last Wednesday of the month at Bradley Billiard Club in 
Bradley, IL.
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm. 
• Players must register for play on tournament day. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee.
• No rebuys are permitted.
• No team play is allowed.
• Players will get one (1) opportunity to play each pinball machine. Total of six (6) machines. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• Top three (3) overall combined scores will be awarded prizes.
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. A portion of the entry fee will go towards the total cash prize 
amount. Total prize amount will be announced after registration is completed. 
Play Rules
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm on the last Wednesday of each month. 
• Players must register on tournament day to participate. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee to participate. Entry fee is divided as follows.
o $3 of each entry fee goes towards game play ($0.50 per game play).
o $1 of each entry fee goes towards International Flipper Pinball Association (IFPA) 
tournament registration.
o $6 of each entry fee goes towards the cash prize. 
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. $6 from each entry fee will be added to the cash prize amount. 
For example, if 20 entry fees are collected, $120 will be added to the cash prize for a total of $220.
• Players will get one (1) chance to play each pinball machine. There are six (6) machines.
• The Tournament Director will activate each game by inserting money into the machine. 
• All scores will be recorded by the League Director. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• The top three highest combined scores will receive a prize. 
• Prizes will be awarded as follows.
o Top combined score will receive 60% of the cash prize and a translite (approximate value 
$100). 
o Second highest combined score will be awarded 30% of the total cash prize and 
promotional bag (approximate value $25). 
o Third highest combined score will be awarded 10% of the cash prize and a promotional bag 
approximately value $25). 
• In the event of a tie, the players will play a sudden death match on machine selected by 
Tournament Director the day of tournament. The highest score will be awarded the position. 
Participation in this tournament is an agreement to abide by the rules of the tournament event. 
GEM Amusements LLC has the right to change, cancel or alter this tournament at any time without prior 
notice. Typographical and other errors are subject to correction. Void where prohibited by law. Awarded 
prizes are based on availability.
The decision of GEM Amusements LLC regarding the selection of winners and all other aspects of the 
contest shall be final and binding in all respects. 
Winner must be 18 years of age or older. To claim a prize, the winner must present a valid, governmentissued photo ID and permit a photocopy be made of ID provided. 
No substitution of a prize by the winner will be permitted unless otherwise specifically stated in these 
Official Rules. If it becomes necessary to substitute a prize due to unavailability of the prize originally 
intended, a prize of equal or greater value will be awarded at the discretion of GEM Amusements LLC. 
The winner’s entry and acceptance of any prize constitutes permission for GEM Amusements LLC to use 
the winner’s name, photograph, likeness, statements, biographical information, voice, and address (city 
and state), in all forms of media, in perpetuity, without notice or further compensation.
Prizes are not transferable. All federal, state, and local taxes, if all expenses related to the receipt and use 
of the prize are the sole responsibility of the winner. By participating, each contest entrant agrees to these 
Official Rules. Winners are required to release, discharge, and hold GEM Amusements LLC, its parent 
and affiliated companies, and their respective directors, officers, employees, and agents, harmless from all 
liabilities, claims or damages arising from participation in this contest and the acceptance, use, misuse or 
possession of the prize. 
Any dispute or situation not covered by the official rules will be resolved by GEM Amusements LLC 
management in a manner deemed by them to be the fairest to all concerned, and that decision shall be final

tournament_name: Pinball Super League: Stern Army Enterrium Monthly
details:
Players of all skill levels are EXTREMELY welcome! $5 entry, $4 to prize pool, $1 to IFPA fees. Prize raffles! Event info can be found by going to next.matchplay.events on your phone and searching Enterrium during the tourney. Four rounds of balanced matchplay on 25-30 pins at Enterrium for qualifying. 7/5/3/1 scoring. Top 16 players qualify for playoffs as long as there are at least 32 players, otherwise top 8. Anyone tied at the 16th place cut line will play a single ball tiebreaker on a random classic pin. All other ties will be broken automatically in matchplay. Playoffs consist of groups of 4 playing a single randomly chosen game, top 2 in each game advance until only 4 players remain. Those 4 players will play a single 4 player game to determine final finishing positions. High seed in each group gets to go last. There is no game selection in any rounds of playoffs due to time constraints at the location.
Payouts for top 8:
5th-8th: $10
4th: 10% of prize pot
3rd: 20% of prize pot and a $10 Enterrium game card
2nd: 30% of prize pot and a $20 Enterrium game card
1st: 40% of prize pot and a $30 Enterrium game card
Format and arena list are subject to change at TD discretion. TD rulings and format decisions are final. Arguing rulings/formats with event TDs may result in a yellow card. IFPA/PAPA pinball rules are generally followed, but TDs reserve the right to differ from these rulings. Up to date rules can be found here:
https://www.ifpapinball.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/PAPA_IFPA-Complete-Competition-Rules-2021.04.06.pdf
Conduct rules can be found here:
http://sundaybest.kittensandwich.com/Chicagoland-Code-of-Conduct/

tournament_name: Craft Beer Pinball League Monthly
details:
Group play begins at 6:30 PM. Please arrive ahead of time for warm-ups, a free beer, and to get registered.

Each player will play through machines available in a random group of four and scores will be tabulated. After Points are totaled a ranked list is generated and playoff groups will be formed.

Ranked groups of four will playoff in a Three Game Playoff on a single machine with the lowest scoring player being eliminated each game, arriving at one winner in each group. Prizes will be awarded to those that finish first in every playoff group. Consolation rounds will be added if prize support exceeds the number of playoff groups.

Points will be submitted from the First Wednesday Events for now, with Third Wednesday events possibly being added down down the road. Cheers Friends!

www.craftbeerpinballleague.com
https://www.facebook.com/CraftBeerPinballLeague

tournament_name: Bounce Milwaukee's Third Friday Tourney
details:
Join us on the third Friday of every month from 6-9 pm.
Winners will claim a custom trophy and a Stern translight or other prizes. We'll often have additional swag courtesy of Stern Pinball, Bounce Milwaukee or area breweries or distilleries.
We will usually rotate through the following pins: Godzilla, Deadpool, The Mandalorian, Avatar, Judge Dredd, Stargate, Starship Troopers, Star Wars EP1, Star Trek, Stern Star Wars, Demolition Man, Terminator 2, Spiderman and James Bond (and sometimes a few more or less)
This is an IFPA - International Flipper Pinball Association sanctioned tournament, and we will pay the IFPA fees for all players. Format will generally be 7 rounds of 7/5/3/1, but may vary some months.
This is an all-ages tournament; on nights that we have 3 or more players under 15, we'll have a separate ceremony and trophy for that age group, but under-15s can (and sometimes do!) place in the regular tourney as well.
There's no need (or way) to register in advance - just come on in!
This is also very open to new players - whether you're experienced or this is your first one, come on in and we'll show you the ropes. Thanks to our Tournament Director (and pinball tech) Nate Oines for organizing every month!
-------------
Machines are on free play, so you have a few options on how to enter:
$7 = Unlimited pinball (and arcade) games plus tournament entry
OR
Buy a Bounce or Everything wristband and the tournament entry will be included. You can come early and bounce, climb, laser tag, Magnetag, build forts, or play any of our pins or arcade games.
--------------
Other details:
-Kitchen, bar and venue open until 9pm.
During, before or after the tournament, check out the 50/50 tournament to benefit Project Pinball Charity!
We don't normally play extra balls , but will play them when there's a side tournament (like the Spider-Man 50/50 or machine-specific side-tourneys from Stern).

tournament_name: Milwaukee Flips:Silverball Saturdays
details:
Tournament Date: August 10th, 2023


New Players and all skill levels Welcome!

$20/$25 Admission + $1 for IFPA fee

4:30PM Doors open for all you can play pinball

5 PM Tournament Starts


Any one can join us for Silverball Saturdays. This is an organized regular tournament that we have once per month. Anyone who wants to play is welcome to attend. Everyone on Saturday nights competes in the organized tournament, but you can still play anything you want at practice, in-between rounds, and when it is over. New players are welcome and I will walk you through how it works when you get here. It's a lot of fun and not stressful at all. You are here to have a good time and you absolutely will!

The $20 Fee covers the main tournament, all game play, bottled water and soda, and payouts. $25 Fee covers all that, plus a few adult beverages. Pay in person when you come to Jim's. This is an individual event and not a team event. Practice starts at 4:30 PM and tournament starts at 5 PM. We will be capping these events at 28 people, for now, so it is highly encouraged you register or RSVP with me in advance. To register please either email me through the website, or through the Facebook group(preferable...contact me for info).


Main Event:

We play 10 Rounds of group match play style pinball with Swiss Seeding. Don't worry if you don't know what that is I can explain it to you very quickly when you show up. You play anything you want during practice from 4:30PM-5PM. Then we start the tournament at 5PM. In-between the 10 rounds of play there will be some down time and you can play anything you want. All games are on Free Play. We play 10 rounds each night. Each round consists of 1 randomly selected game that you play with 3(or 2) other people. Based on your score for that game you will either get 1st (7 points), 2nd (5 points), 3rd (3 points) or 4th (1 points). Scoring is 7-4-1 for 3-player groups.Then on the subsequent rounds the computer will match you up on a different game typically with different players who have a similar cumulative points earned for the night as you do. The top 3 players overall will receive payouts. Each tournament will also earn you some WPPR (World Pinball Player Ranking) points and get you both a State of Wisconsin and International ranking with the IFPA.
TGP--10 rounds/games of group/4 player match play=20 games toward TGP(80%)

tournament_name: Grand Rapids Pinball League
details:
The Grand Rapids Pinball League was started in November 2012 by Rodney
Minch to provide an opportunity for individuals in Grand Rapids to
play competitive pinball in a fun and friendly environment. The league
is open to anyone who has an interest in playing pinball and all ages
and skill levels are welcome!

League nights are the 1st and 3rd Wednesday of each month at 7pm at
RLM Amusements. Doors open at 5pm for practice. Each season consists
of 6 league nights. Players will play in groups of 4 and play 5 games
each league night. Please arrive and check in by 6:50pm to be added to
the roster for that night. RLM Amusements is located at 4318
Plainfield Ave Suite K Grand Rapids, MI 49525. Players are encouraged
to come early to practice and socialize.

Hope to see you there!

tournament_name: Stern Army - I/O Arcade Bar Monthly Tournament
details: This is a monthly public tournament occurs the fourth Wednesday of every month. In person registration opens at 6:30pm. There is no limit on participants. We play 2.5 hours of qualifying four-player MatchPlay groups across 21 machines. This is a minimum of 5 qualifying rounds and a maximum of 6 qualifying rounds. The top four contestants play 8 rounds of PAPA style group match play to determine the top four ranking.

tournament_name: Stern Army
details:
How it Works
• Pinball tournament to be held on the last Wednesday of the month at Bradley Billiard Club in 
Bradley, IL.
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm. 
• Players must register for play on tournament day. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee.
• No rebuys are permitted.
• No team play is allowed.
• Players will get one (1) opportunity to play each pinball machine. Total of six (6) machines. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• Top three (3) overall combined scores will be awarded prizes.
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. A portion of the entry fee will go towards the total cash prize 
amount. Total prize amount will be announced after registration is completed. 
Play Rules
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm on the last Wednesday of each month. 
• Players must register on tournament day to participate. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee to participate. Entry fee is divided as follows.
o $3 of each entry fee goes towards game play ($0.50 per game play).
o $1 of each entry fee goes towards International Flipper Pinball Association (IFPA) 
tournament registration.
o $6 of each entry fee goes towards the cash prize. 
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. $6 from each entry fee will be added to the cash prize amount. 
For example, if 20 entry fees are collected, $120 will be added to the cash prize for a total of $220.
• Players will get one (1) chance to play each pinball machine. There are six (6) machines.
• The Tournament Director will activate each game by inserting money into the machine. 
• All scores will be recorded by the League Director. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• The top three highest combined scores will receive a prize. 
• Prizes will be awarded as follows.
o Top combined score will receive 60% of the cash prize and a translite (approximate value 
$100). 
o Second highest combined score will be awarded 30% of the total cash prize and 
promotional bag (approximate value $25). 
o Third highest combined score will be awarded 10% of the cash prize and a promotional bag 
approximately value $25). 
• In the event of a tie, the players will play a sudden death match on machine selected by 
Tournament Director the day of tournament. The highest score will be awarded the position. 
Participation in this tournament is an agreement to abide by the rules of the tournament event. 
GEM Amusements LLC has the right to change, cancel or alter this tournament at any time without prior 
notice. Typographical and other errors are subject to correction. Void where prohibited by law. Awarded 
prizes are based on availability.
The decision of GEM Amusements LLC regarding the selection of winners and all other aspects of the 
contest shall be final and binding in all respects. 
Winner must be 18 years of age or older. To claim a prize, the winner must present a valid, governmentissued photo ID and permit a photocopy be made of ID provided. 
No substitution of a prize by the winner will be permitted unless otherwise specifically stated in these 
Official Rules. If it becomes necessary to substitute a prize due to unavailability of the prize originally 
intended, a prize of equal or greater value will be awarded at the discretion of GEM Amusements LLC. 
The winner’s entry and acceptance of any prize constitutes permission for GEM Amusements LLC to use 
the winner’s name, photograph, likeness, statements, biographical information, voice, and address (city 
and state), in all forms of media, in perpetuity, without notice or further compensation.
Prizes are not transferable. All federal, state, and local taxes, if all expenses related to the receipt and use 
of the prize are the sole responsibility of the winner. By participating, each contest entrant agrees to these 
Official Rules. Winners are required to release, discharge, and hold GEM Amusements LLC, its parent 
and affiliated companies, and their respective directors, officers, employees, and agents, harmless from all 
liabilities, claims or damages arising from participation in this contest and the acceptance, use, misuse or 
possession of the prize. 
Any dispute or situation not covered by the official rules will be resolved by GEM Amusements LLC 
management in a manner deemed by them to be the fairest to all concerned, and that decision shall be final 
and binding on all participants. In addition, GEM Amusements LLC reserves the right to void any entry, 
and/or to change, cancel or modify this promotion at any time.
By entering this tournament, entrants agree to abide by all terms of the official rules. Must be present to win

details:
Players of all skill levels are EXTREMELY welcome! $5 entry, $4 to prize pool, $1 to IFPA fees. Prize raffles! Event info can be found by going to next.matchplay.events on your phone and searching Enterrium during the tourney. Four rounds of balanced matchplay on 25-30 pins at Enterrium for qualifying. 7/5/3/1 scoring. Top 16 players qualify for playoffs as long as there are at least 32 players, otherwise top 8. Anyone tied at the 16th place cut line will play a single ball tiebreaker on a random classic pin. All other ties will be broken automatically in matchplay. Playoffs consist of groups of 4 playing a single randomly chosen game, top 2 in each game advance until only 4 players remain. Those 4 players will play a single 4 player game to determine final finishing positions. High seed in each group gets to go last. There is no game selection in any rounds of playoffs due to time constraints at the location.
Payouts for top 8:
5th-8th: $10
4th: 10% of prize pot
3rd: 20% of prize pot and a $10 Enterrium game card
2nd: 30% of prize pot and a $20 Enterrium game card
1st: 40% of prize pot and a $30 Enterrium game card
Format and arena list are subject to change at TD discretion. TD rulings and format decisions are final. Arguing rulings/formats with event TDs may result in a yellow card. IFPA/PAPA pinball rules are generally followed, but TDs reserve the right to differ from these rulings. Up to date rules can be found here:
https://www.ifpapinball.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/PAPA_IFPA-Complete-Competition-Rules-2021.04.06.pdf
Conduct rules can be found here:
http://sundaybest.kittensandwich.com/Chicagoland-Code-of-Conduct/

tournament_name: Craft Beer Pinball League Monthly
details:
Group play begins at 6:30 PM. Please arrive ahead of time for warm-ups, a free beer, and to get registered.

Each player will play through machines available in a random group of four and scores will be tabulated. After Points are totaled a ranked list is generated and playoff groups will be formed.

Ranked groups of four will playoff in a Three Game Playoff on a single machine with the lowest scoring player being eliminated each game, arriving at one winner in each group. Prizes will be awarded to those that finish first in every playoff group. Consolation rounds will be added if prize support exceeds the number of playoff groups.

Points will be submitted from the First Wednesday Events for now, with Third Wednesday events possibly being added down down the road. Cheers Friends!

www.craftbeerpinballleague.com
https://www.facebook.com/CraftBeerPinballLeague

tournament_name: RLM Amusements Weekly Pinball Tournament
details:
RLM Amusements hosts a Max Matchplay pinball tournament every Thursday night! The tournament is open to all ages and all skill levels. The entry fee is $10 and all the games are on free play. The doors open at 5pm for practice and the tournament starts at 7pm. Top 8/12/16 players (depending on how many people show up) face off in the finals. Feel free to bring any food or drinks you may want. We have a refrigerator, freezer and microwave available.

RLM Amusements is located at 4318 Plainfield Ave NE Suite K Grand Rapids, MI 49525. We are in the back of the building directly behind H&R Block. Plenty of off street parking available. Hope to see you here!

IFPA rules

Machines are on street rules, in other words, we plunge extra balls. Special tournament modes may be used and will be called out at machine assignment.

It is the players responsibility to make sure it is their turn before plunging the ball! If you play someone else's ball you get a DQ for that game. If you walk up to a machine and you can't tell who's turn it is, contact a TD (tournament director) to make the call.

All rulings must be made by a TD.

No abuse whatsoever is acceptable, be nice to each other and yourself and The Machines.

Nudging is allowed. Sliding, slapping or end of ball frustration abuse is strictly prohibited.

tournament_name: Bounce Milwaukee's Third Friday Tourney
details:
Join us on the third Friday of every month from 6-9 pm.
Winners will claim a custom trophy and a Stern translight or other prizes. We'll often have additional swag courtesy of Stern Pinball, Bounce Milwaukee or area breweries or distilleries.
We will usually rotate through the following pins: Godzilla, Deadpool, The Mandalorian, Avatar, Judge Dredd, Stargate, Starship Troopers, Star Wars EP1, Star Trek, Stern Star Wars, Demolition Man, Terminator 2, Spiderman and James Bond (and sometimes a few more or less)
This is an IFPA - International Flipper Pinball Association sanctioned tournament, and we will pay the IFPA fees for all players. Format will generally be 7 rounds of 7/5/3/1, but may vary some months.
This is an all-ages tournament; on nights that we have 3 or more players under 15, we'll have a separate ceremony and trophy for that age group, but under-15s can (and sometimes do!) place in the regular tourney as well.
There's no need (or way) to register in advance - just come on in!
This is also very open to new players - whether you're experienced or this is your first one, come on in and we'll show you the ropes. Thanks to our Tournament Director (and pinball tech) Nate Oines for organizing every month!
-------------
Machines are on free play, so you have a few options on how to enter:
$7 = Unlimited pinball (and arcade) games plus tournament entry
OR
Buy a Bounce or Everything wristband and the tournament entry will be included. You can come early and bounce, climb, laser tag, Magnetag, build forts, or play any of our pins or arcade games.
--------------
Other details:
-Kitchen, bar and venue open until 9pm.
During, before or after the tournament, check out the 50/50 tournament to benefit Project Pinball Charity!
We don't normally play extra balls , but will play them when there's a side tournament (like the Spider-Man 50/50 or machine-specific side-tourneys from Stern).

tournament_name: Stern Army - I/O Arcade Bar Monthly Tournament
details: This is a monthly public tournament occurs the fourth Wednesday of every month. In person registration opens at 6:30pm. There is no limit on participants. We play 2.5 hours of qualifying four-player MatchPlay groups across 21 machines. This is a minimum of 5 qualifying rounds and a maximum of 6 qualifying rounds. Along the way we give out prizes from our sponsors based on hi/lo scores, last place finishes and the occasional random throw of the dice. The top four contestants play 8 rounds of PAPA style group match play to determine the top four ranking.

tournament_name: B&C Chicago Monthly Women's Tournament
details: Join us for our monthly women's tournament at Logan Arcade! $5 buy-in goes to charity chosen by players. We start at 7:30pm; format subject to change but usually 5 rounds of group matchplay with a final.

tournament_name: Stern Army
details:
How it Works
• Pinball tournament to be held on the last Wednesday of the month at Bradley Billiard Club in 
Bradley, IL.
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm. 
• Players must register for play on tournament day. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee.
• No rebuys are permitted.
• No team play is allowed.
• Players will get one (1) opportunity to play each pinball machine. Total of six (6) machines. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• Top three (3) overall combined scores will be awarded prizes.
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. A portion of the entry fee will go towards the total cash prize 
amount. Total prize amount will be announced after registration is completed. 
Play Rules
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm on the last Wednesday of each month. 
• Players must register on tournament day to participate. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee to participate. Entry fee is divided as follows.
o $3 of each entry fee goes towards game play ($0.50 per game play).
o $1 of each entry fee goes towards International Flipper Pinball Association (IFPA) 
tournament registration.
o $6 of each entry fee goes towards the cash prize. 
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. $6 from each entry fee will be added to the cash prize amount. 
For example, if 20 entry fees are collected, $120 will be added to the cash prize for a total of $220.
• Players will get one (1) chance to play each pinball machine. There are six (6) machines.
• The Tournament Director will activate each game by inserting money into the machine. 
• All scores will be recorded by the League Director. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• The top three highest combined scores will receive a prize. 
• Prizes will be awarded as follows.
o Top combined score will receive 60% of the cash prize and a translite (approximate value 
$100). 
o Second highest combined score will be awarded 30% of the total cash prize and 
promotional bag (approximate value $25). 
o Third highest combined score will be awarded 10% of the cash prize and a promotional bag 
approximately value $25). 
• In the event of a tie, the players will play a sudden death match on machine selected by 
Tournament Director the day of tournament. The highest score will be awarded the position. 
Participation in this tournament is an agreement to abide by the rules of the tournament event.

notice. Typographical and other errors are subject to correction. Void where prohibited by law. Awarded 
prizes are based on availability.
The decision of GEM Amusements LLC regarding the selection of winners and all other aspects of the 
contest shall be final and binding in all respects. 
Winner must be 18 years of age or older. To claim a prize, the winner must present a valid, governmentissued photo ID and permit a photocopy be made of ID provided. 
No substitution of a prize by the winner will be permitted unless otherwise specifically stated in these 
Official Rules. If it becomes necessary to substitute a prize due to unavailability of the prize originally 
intended, a prize of equal or greater value will be awarded at the discretion of GEM Amusements LLC. 
The winner’s entry and acceptance of any prize constitutes permission for GEM Amusements LLC to use 
the winner’s name, photograph, likeness, statements, biographical information, voice, and address (city 
and state), in all forms of media, in perpetuity, without notice or further compensation.
Prizes are not transferable. All federal, state, and local taxes, if all expenses related to the receipt and use 
of the prize are the sole responsibility of the winner. By participating, each contest entrant agrees to these 
Official Rules. Winners are required to release, discharge, and hold GEM Amusements LLC, its parent 
and affiliated companies, and their respective directors, officers, employees, and agents, harmless from all

details:
Monday Night Pinball 7pm

Qualifying 

Match Play 4 player groups, 7, 5, 3, 1 scoring

After qualifying we will switch to a PAPA Finals.

Ties to determine finalists will be broken on Firepower or equivalent.

Finalists (50% of field must be cut for a finals, also finals must contain at least 10% of field). Round 1 finals will play 4 games in 4 player groups. Top 2 from each group advance to round 2. Ties will be broken on Firepower or equivalent.

Round 2 finals will play 4 games in a 4 player group. Top 2 from this group advance to round 3 (successive rounds will follow the same format). Ties will be broken on Firepower or equivalent. The last round is determined by only 4 players remaining.

tournament_name: Flip Well Pinball League
details:
Get some regular play in with our seasonal Flip Well league. Games take place on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday of each month, with a Finals the first Wednesday of the month following the sixth session. At just a $5 entry fee per season plus coin drops, it’s the cheapest date night in town!

4 games in 4 player groups per night

Finals will be top 16 - 4 player groups with 4,2,1,0 scoring

Pinball Wizard's Palace @ One Well Brewing
55 Pins on the floor all set $.75 per game

tournament_name: Craft Beer Pinball League Monthly
details:
Group play begins at 6:30 PM. Please arrive ahead of time for warm-ups, a free beer, and to get registered.

Each player will play through machines available in a random group of four and scores will be tabulated. After Points are totaled a ranked list is generated and playoff groups will be formed.

Ranked groups of four will playoff in a Three Game Playoff on a single machine with the lowest scoring player being eliminated each game, arriving at one winner in each group. Prizes will be awarded to those that finish first in every playoff group. Consolation rounds will be added if prize support exceeds the number of playoff groups.

Points will be submitted from the First Wednesday Events for now, with Third Wednesday events possibly being added down down the road. Cheers Friends!

www.craftbeerpinballleague.com
https://www.facebook.com/CraftBeerPinballLeague

tournament_name: Pinball Super League: Stern Army Enterrium Monthly
details:
Players of all skill levels are EXTREMELY welcome! $5 entry, $4 to prize pool, $1 to IFPA fees. Prize raffles! Event info can be found by going to next.matchplay.events on your phone and searching Enterrium during the tourney. Four rounds of balanced matchplay on 25-30 pins at Enterrium for qualifying. 7/5/3/1 scoring. Top 16 players qualify for playoffs as long as there are at least 32 players, otherwise top 8. Anyone tied at the 16th place cut line will play a single ball tiebreaker on a random classic pin. All other ties will be broken automatically in matchplay. Playoffs consist of groups of 4 playing a single randomly chosen game, top 2 in each game advance until only 4 players remain. Those 4 players will play a single 4 player game to determine final finishing positions. High seed in each group gets to go last. There is no game selection in any rounds of playoffs due to time constraints at the location.
Payouts for top 8:
5th-8th: $10
4th: 10% of prize pot
3rd: 20% of prize pot and a $10 Enterrium game card
2nd: 30% of prize pot and a $20 Enterrium game card
1st: 40% of prize pot and a $30 Enterrium game card
Format and arena list are subject to change at TD discretion. TD rulings and format decisions are final. Arguing rulings/formats with event TDs may result in a yellow card. IFPA/PAPA pinball rules are generally followed, but TDs reserve the right to differ from these rulings. Up to date rules can be found here:
https://www.ifpapinball.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/PAPA_IFPA-Complete-Competition-Rules-2021.04.06.pdf
Conduct rules can be found here:
http://sundaybest.kittensandwich.com/Chicagoland-Code-of-Conduct/

tournament_name: Belles & Chimes Chicago Season 12
details:
Welcome to the Chicago Chapter of Belles & Chimes! We are an IFPA sanctioned women's pinball league that usually plays every other Wednesday night at Logan Arcade, 2408 W Fullerton, Chicago. All skill levels welcome!

Play will start at 7:30 pm. Players will play 2 rounds of matchplay, 3 games per round. New to this season, league takes your top 5 scores of the season and drops your 2 lowest scores. Top 12 finishers will compete in a final to determine final standings, and those qualifying lower than top 12 will play a final for b-division prizes. You must play in at least 3 matches to receive IFPA points.

Due to high demand, we are capping the league at 70 players. Registration will be available via Matchplay.com on August 16th to register. If you'd like to be added to our email list to receive the link, email bellesandchimeschicago@gmail.com.

We use an inclusive definition of “woman” and “female” and we welcome trans women, genderqueer women, and non-binary people.

8/16 - intro / orientation / pre-registration
8/23 - Matchplay 1
9/6 - Matchplay 2
9/20 - Matchplay 3
10/4- Matchplay 4
10/11 - Matchplay 5
-- NOTE we are playing back to back Wednesdays due to Expo Events 
11/1- Matchplay 6
11/8 - Matchplay 7
- - NOTE we are playing back to back Wednesdays due to Thanksgiving Holiday
11/15 - A&B division tourney
12/6- Pizza party!

League dues are $25 per season and will go towards prizes, admin costs, and t-shirts. Drop-ins are welcome, $5 per match.
Belles & Chimes is a national network of women's pinball leagues that started in Oakland, CA in 2013. B&C now represents in Cleveland, Denver, Eugene, New York, Oklahoma City, Phoenix, Portland ME, and Portland, OR.
www.bellesandchimespinball.com

tournament_name: RLM Amusements Weekly Pinball Tournament
details:
RLM Amusements hosts a Max Matchplay pinball tournament every Thursday night! The tournament is open to all ages and all skill levels. The entry fee is $10 and all the games are on free play. The doors open at 5pm for practice and the tournament starts at 7pm. Top 8/12/16 players (depending on how many people show up) face off in the finals. tournament_name: Bounce Milwaukee's Third Friday Tourney
details:
Join us on the third Friday of every month from 6-9 pm.
Winners will claim a custom trophy and a Stern translight or other prizes. We'll often have additional swag courtesy of Stern Pinball, Bounce Milwaukee or area breweries or distilleries.
We will usually rotate through the following pins: Godzilla, Deadpool, The Mandalorian, Avatar, Judge Dredd, Stargate, Starship Troopers, Star Wars EP1, Star Trek, Stern Star Wars, Demolition Man, Terminator 2, Spiderman and James Bond (and sometimes a few more or less)
This is an IFPA - International Flipper Pinball Association sanctioned tournament, and we will pay the IFPA fees for all players. Format will generally be 7 rounds of 7/5/3/1, but may vary some months.
This is an all-ages tournament; on nights that we have 3 or more players under 15, we'll have a separate ceremony and trophy for that age group, but under-15s can (and sometimes do!) place in the regular tourney as well.
There's no need (or way) to register in advance - just come on in!
This is also very open to new players - whether you're experienced or this is your first one, come on in and we'll show you the ropes. Thanks to our Tournament Director (and pinball tech) Nate Oines for organizing every month!
-------------
Machines are on free play, so you have a few options on how to enter:
$7 = Unlimited pinball (and arcade) games plus tournament entry
OR
Buy a Bounce or Everything wristband and the tournament entry will be included. You can come early and bounce, climb, laser tag, Magnetag, build forts, or play any of our pins or arcade games.
--------------
Other details:
-Kitchen, bar and venue open until 9pm.
During, before or after the tournament, check out the 50/50 tournament to benefit Project Pinball Charity!
We don't normally play extra balls , but will play them when there's a side tournament (like the Spider-Man 50/50 or machine-specific side-tourneys from Stern).

tournament_name: Stern Army Fort Wayne Pinball Wizards World Weekly
details:
Monday Night Pinball 7pm

Qualifying 

Match Play 4 player groups, 7, 5, 3, 1 scoring

After qualifying we will switch to a PAPA Finals.

Ties to determine finalists will be broken on Firepower or equivalent.

Finalists (50% of field must be cut for a finals, also finals must contain at least 10% of field). The number of players in the finals field will be determined by the number of qualifiers. a maximum of 16 unless there is a conflict with the rules, then the player count will be adjusted as necessary.

Round 1 finals will play 4 games in 4 player groups. Top 2 from each group advance to round 2. Ties will be broken on Firepower or equivalent.

Round 2 finals will play 4 games in a 4 player group. Top 2 from this group advance to round 3 (successive rounds will follow the same format). Ties will be broken on Firepower or equivalent. The last round is determined by only 4 players remaining.

details: This is a monthly public tournament occurs the fourth Wednesday of every month. In person registration opens at 6:30pm. There is no limit on participants. tournament_name: Stern Army
details:
How it Works
• Pinball tournament to be held on the last Wednesday of the month at Bradley Billiard Club in 
Bradley, IL.
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm. 
• Players must register for play on tournament day. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee.
• No rebuys are permitted.
• No team play is allowed.
• Players will get one (1) opportunity to play each pinball machine. Total of six (6) machines. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• Top three (3) overall combined scores will be awarded prizes.
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. A portion of the entry fee will go towards the total cash prize 
amount. Total prize amount will be announced after registration is completed. 
Play Rules
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm on the last Wednesday of each month. 
• Players must register on tournament day to participate. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee to participate. Entry fee is divided as follows.
o $3 of each entry fee goes towards game play ($0.50 per game play).
o $1 of each entry fee goes towards International Flipper Pinball Association (IFPA) 
tournament registration.
o $6 of each entry fee goes towards the cash prize. 
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. $6 from each entry fee will be added to the cash prize amount. 
For example, if 20 entry fees are collected, $120 will be added to the cash prize for a total of $220.
• Players will get one (1) chance to play each pinball machine. There are six (6) machines.
• The Tournament Director will activate each game by inserting money into the machine. 
• All scores will be recorded by the League Director. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• The top three highest combined scores will receive a prize. 
• Prizes will be awarded as follows.
o Top combined score will receive 60% of the cash prize and a translite (approximate value 
$100). 
o Second highest combined score will be awarded 30% of the total cash prize and 
promotional bag (approximate value $25). 
o Third highest combined score will be awarded 10% of the cash prize and a promotional bag 
approximately value $25). 
• In the event of a tie, the players will play a sudden death match on machine selected by 
Tournament Director the day of tournament. The highest score will be awarded the position. 
Participation in this tournament is an agreement to abide by the rules of the tournament event. 
GEM Amusements LLC has the right to change, cancel or alter this tournament at any time without prior 
notice. Typographical and other errors are subject to correction. Void where prohibited by law. Awarded 
prizes are based on availability.
The decision of GEM Amusements LLC regarding the selection of winners and all other aspects of the 
contest shall be final and binding in all respects. 
Winner must be 18 years of age or older. To claim a prize, the winner must present a valid, governmentissued photo ID and permit a photocopy be made of ID provided. 
No substitution of a prize by the winner will be permitted unless otherwise specifically stated in these 
Official Rules. If it becomes necessary to substitute a prize due to unavailability of the prize originally 
intended, a prize of equal or greater value will be awarded at the discretion of GEM Amusements LLC. 
The winner’s entry and acceptance of any prize constitutes permission for GEM Amusements LLC to use 
the winner’s name, photograph, likeness, statements, biographical information, voice, and address (city 
and state), in all forms of media, in perpetuity, without notice or further compensation.
Prizes are not transferable. All federal, state, and local taxes, if all expenses related to the receipt and use 
of the prize are the sole responsibility of the winner. By participating, each contest entrant agrees to these 
Official Rules. Winners are required to release, discharge, and hold GEM Amusements LLC, its parent 
and affiliated companies, and their respective directors, officers, employees, and agents, harmless from all 
liabilities, claims or damages arising from participation in this contest and the acceptance, use, misuse or 
possession of the prize. 
Any dispute or situation not covered by the official rules will be resolved by GEM Amusements LLC 
management in a manner deemed by them to be the fairest to all concerned, and that decision shall be final 
and binding on all participants. In addition, GEM Amusements LLC reserves the right to void any entry, 
and/or to change, cancel or modify this promotion at any time.
By entering this tournament, entrants agree to abide by all terms of the official rules. Must be present to win

tournament_name: CHIMP League Season 1
details:
CHIcagoland Multilocation Pinball League aka CHIMP for short. Its an invitational pinball league for 32 players that will run seasons and finals. 

Our first season in 2023 will run Sept-Nov on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of the month. Matches will be played in rotating locations in the Chicagoland suburbs TBA. We'll play 6 weeks and take your 5 best week league order and to seed finals.

W1: 9/12
W2: 9/26
W3: 10/10
W4: 10/24
W5: 11/14
W6: 11/28

Finals: 12/2 (Saturday)

tournament_name: Stern Army Fort Wayne Pinball Wizards World Weekly
details:
Monday Night Pinball 7pm

Qualifying 

Match Play 4 player groups, 7, 5, 3, 1 scoring

After qualifying we will switch to a PAPA Finals.

Ties to determine finalists will be broken on Firepower or equivalent.

Finalists (50% of field must be cut for a finals, also finals must contain at least 10% of field). Round 2 finals will play 4 games in a 4 player group. Top 2 from this group advance to round 3 (successive rounds will follow the same format). Ties will be broken on Firepower or equivalent. The last round is determined by only 4 players remaining.

tournament_name: Pinball Super League: Stern Army Enterrium Monthly
details:
Players of all skill levels are EXTREMELY welcome! $5 entry, $4 to prize pool, $1 to IFPA fees. Prize raffles! Event info can be found by going to next.matchplay.events on your phone and searching Enterrium during the tourney. Four rounds of balanced matchplay on 25-30 pins at Enterrium for qualifying. 7/5/3/1 scoring. Top 16 players qualify for playoffs as long as there are at least 32 players, otherwise top 8. Anyone tied at the 16th place cut line will play a single ball tiebreaker on a random classic pin. All other ties will be broken automatically in matchplay. Playoffs consist of groups of 4 playing a single randomly chosen game, top 2 in each game advance until only 4 players remain. Those 4 players will play a single 4 player game to determine final finishing positions. High seed in each group gets to go last. There is no game selection in any rounds of playoffs due to time constraints at the location.
Payouts for top 8:
5th-8th: $10
4th: 10% of prize pot
3rd: 20% of prize pot and a $10 Enterrium game card
2nd: 30% of prize pot and a $20 Enterrium game card
1st: 40% of prize pot and a $30 Enterrium game card
Format and arena list are subject to change at TD discretion. TD rulings and format decisions are final. Arguing rulings/formats with event TDs may result in a yellow card. IFPA/PAPA pinball rules are generally followed, but TDs reserve the right to differ from these rulings. Up to date rules can be found here:
https://www.ifpapinball.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/PAPA_IFPA-Complete-Competition-Rules-2021.04.06.pdf
Conduct rules can be found here:
http://sundaybest.kittensandwich.com/Chicagoland-Code-of-Conduct/

tournament_name: Craft Beer Pinball League Monthly
details:
Group play begins at 6:30 PM. Please arrive ahead of time for warm-ups, a free beer, and to get registered.

Each player will play through machines available in a random group of four and scores will be tabulated. After Points are totaled a ranked list is generated and playoff groups will be formed.

Ranked groups of four will playoff in a Three Game Playoff on a single machine with the lowest scoring player being eliminated each game, arriving at one winner in each group. Prizes will be awarded to those that finish first in every playoff group. Consolation rounds will be added if prize support exceeds the number of playoff groups.

Points will be submitted from the First Wednesday Events for now, with Third Wednesday events possibly being added down down the road. Cheers Friends!

www.craftbeerpinballleague.com
https://www.facebook.com/CraftBeerPinballLeague

tournament_name: RLM Amusements Weekly Pinball Tournament
details:
RLM Amusements hosts a Max Matchplay pinball tournament every Thursday night! The tournament is open to all ages and all skill levels. The entry fee is $10 and all the games are on free play. The doors open at 5pm for practice and the tournament starts at 7pm. Top 8/12/16 players (depending on how many people show up) face off in the finals. We stream our tournaments on Twitch at https://twitch.tv/rlmamusements. Feel free to bring any food or drinks you may want. We have a refrigerator, freezer and microwave available.

RLM Amusements is located at 4318 Plainfield Ave NE Suite K Grand Rapids, MI 49525. We are in the back of the building directly behind H&R Block. Plenty of off street parking available. Hope to see you here!

tournament_name: EEP League Season 1 (Enterrium's Electric Pinball)
details:
New! Starting a bimonthly league at Enterrium starting August 31st. Start time is 7:30pm. This league will run for 9 weeks including a final. We will take the best 6/8 matches meaning players can drop 2 weeks. Players will play in groups of 3/4 and will complete 4 games each meet. Scoring will be 7/5/3/1. 

After 8 weeks, the finals will be the same format with players either in divisions or an overall bracket allowing up to 50% off players. This will be determined by player count and is subject to change based on player count. 

This is an open league, which means all skill levels and genders are welcome to register (with a small fee that will go to prizes) and participate.

tournament_name: Bounce Milwaukee's Third Friday Tourney
details:
Join us on the third Friday of every month from 6-9 pm.
Winners will claim a custom trophy and a Stern translight or other prizes. We'll often have additional swag courtesy of Stern Pinball, Bounce Milwaukee or area breweries or distilleries.
We will usually rotate through the following pins: Godzilla, Deadpool, The Mandalorian, Avatar, Judge Dredd, Stargate, Starship Troopers, Star Wars EP1, Star Trek, Stern Star Wars, Demolition Man, Terminator 2, Spiderman and James Bond (and sometimes a few more or less)
This is an IFPA - International Flipper Pinball Association sanctioned tournament, and we will pay the IFPA fees for all players. Format will generally be 7 rounds of 7/5/3/1, but may vary some months.
This is an all-ages tournament; on nights that we have 3 or more players under 15, we'll have a separate ceremony and trophy for that age group, but under-15s can (and sometimes do!) place in the regular tourney as well.
There's no need (or way) to register in advance - just come on in!
This is also very open to new players - whether you're experienced or this is your first one, come on in and we'll show you the ropes. Thanks to our Tournament Director (and pinball tech) Nate Oines for organizing every month!
-------------
Machines are on free play, so you have a few options on how to enter:
$7 = Unlimited pinball (and arcade) games plus tournament entry
OR
Buy a Bounce or Everything wristband and the tournament entry will be included. You can come early and bounce, climb, laser tag, Magnetag, build forts, or play any of our pins or arcade games.
--------------
Other details:
-Kitchen, bar and venue open until 9pm.
During, before or after the tournament, check out the 50/50 tournament to benefit Project Pinball Charity!
We don't normally play extra balls , but will play them when there's a side tournament (like the Spider-Man 50/50 or machine-specific side-tourneys from Stern).

tournament_name: Grand Rapids Pinball League
details:
The Grand Rapids Pinball League was started in November 2012 by Rodney
Minch to provide an opportunity for individuals in Grand Rapids to
play competitive pinball in a fun and friendly environment. The league
is open to anyone who has an interest in playing pinball and all ages
and skill levels are welcome!

League nights are the 1st and 3rd Wednesday of each month at 7pm at
RLM Amusements. Doors open at 5pm for practice. Each season consists
of 6 league nights. Players will play in groups of 4 and play 5 games
each league night. Please arrive and check in by 6:50pm to be added to
the roster for that night. RLM Amusements is located at 4318
Plainfield Ave Suite K Grand Rapids, MI 49525. Players are encouraged
to come early to practice and socialize.

Hope to see you there!

tournament_name: Northwest Indiana Pinball League
details: Open to the public pinball league. Play takes place over 16 weeks followed by a Finals Night tournament for those players with 40 or more games played in the season. Finals Night consists of a best two of three game double elimation format with the top half of the league being the "A" division and the bottom half playing in the "B" Division to determine the final standings.

tournament_name: North End Pub Fall / Winter League 2023
details:
Our league will meet on the 1st and 3rd Thursday of each month for a league session. We will play 8 total nights. Each night is 4 games of 4 player match play. The best 6 weeks count in the final standings. The finals are Flip Frenzy with each win counting as an extra point added to the season total standings. Finals will take place August 31st.

Anyone is welcome to come and play. There is no fee to join the league, just need quarters for coin drop.

League will Start September 7th and end December 21st.

tournament_name: 2023 Stern Army Women of Wizard's World
details:
2023 Stern Army Women of Wizard's World Belles and Chimes Fort Wayne Group Match Play Tournament.

$1 for IFPA Fee and coin drop. 

Event starts at 10am sharp EVERY Saturday Morning.

8 round - 4 Player Groups - 1 Game per round. Every player will play 8 games. Only ties for first place will be broken by a one game playoff on Firepower or something similar. IFPA 7, 5, 3, 1 Scoring (7,4,1).

January 7, 14, 21, 28
February 4, 11, 18, 25
March 4, 11, 18, 25
April 1, 8, 15, 22, 29
May 6, 13, 20, 27
June 3, 10, 17, 24
July 1, 8, 15, 22, 29
August 5, 12, 19, 26
September 2, 9, 16, 23, 30
October 7, 14, 21, 28
November 4, 11, 18, 25
December 2, 9, 16, 23, 30

IFPA rules

Machines are on street rules, in other words, we plunge extra balls. Special tournament modes may be used and will be called out at machine assignment.

It is the players responsibility to make sure it is their turn before plunging the ball! If you play someone else's ball you get a DQ for that game. If you walk up to a machine and you can't tell who's turn it is, contact a TD (tournament director) to make the call.

All rulings must be made by a TD.

No abuse whatsoever is acceptable, be nice to each other and yourself and The Machines.

Nudging is allowed. Sliding, slapping or end of ball frustration abuse is strictly prohibited.

tournament_name: Stern Army Fort Wayne Pinball Wizards World Weekly
details:
Monday Night Pinball 7pm

Qualifying 

Match Play 4 player groups, 7, 5, 3, 1 scoring

After qualifying we will switch to a PAPA Finals.

Ties to determine finalists will be broken on Firepower or equivalent.

Finalists (50% of field must be cut for a finals, also finals must contain at least 10% of field). The number of players in the finals field will be determined by the number of qualifiers. a maximum of 16 unless there is a conflict with the rules, then the player count will be adjusted as necessary.

Round 1 finals will play 4 games in 4 player groups. Top 2 from each group advance to round 2. Ties will be broken on Firepower or equivalent.

Round 2 finals will play 4 games in a 4 player group. Top 2 from this group advance to round 3 (successive rounds will follow the same format). Ties will be broken on Firepower or equivalent. The last round is determined by only 4 players remaining.

tournament_name: LakeSide Pinball Tournament
details:
The Format and the amount of games played changes here with the size of our player pool. 

We normally end up running Round Robbin formats of between 7 to 9 rounds total and between 7 to 12 pinballs in the mix. 


If our player size increases then we can adapt the group match play format and other methods of play.

tournament_name: Stern Army - I/O Arcade Bar Monthly Tournament
details: This is a monthly public tournament occurs the fourth Wednesday of every month. In person registration opens at 6:30pm. There is no limit on participants. We play 2.5 hours of qualifying four-player MatchPlay groups across 21 machines. This is a minimum of 5 qualifying rounds and a maximum of 6 qualifying rounds. Along the way we give out prizes from our sponsors based on hi/lo scores, last place finishes and the occasional random throw of the dice. The top four contestants play 8 rounds of PAPA style group match play to determine the top four ranking.

tournament_name: B&C Chicago Monthly Women's Tournament
details: Join us for our monthly women's tournament at Logan Arcade! $5 buy-in goes to charity chosen by players. We start at 7:30pm; format subject to change but usually 5 rounds of group matchplay with a final.

tournament_name: Stern Army
details:
How it Works
• Pinball tournament to be held on the last Wednesday of the month at Bradley Billiard Club in 
Bradley, IL.
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm. 
• Players must register for play on tournament day. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee.
• No rebuys are permitted.
• No team play is allowed.
• Players will get one (1) opportunity to play each pinball machine. Total of six (6) machines. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• Top three (3) overall combined scores will be awarded prizes.
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. A portion of the entry fee will go towards the total cash prize 
amount. Total prize amount will be announced after registration is completed. 
Play Rules
• Tournament begins at 6:00 pm on the last Wednesday of each month. 
• Players must register on tournament day to participate. Registration begins at 5:00 pm.
• There is a $10 entry fee to participate. Entry fee is divided as follows.
o $3 of each entry fee goes towards game play ($0.50 per game play).
o $1 of each entry fee goes towards International Flipper Pinball Association (IFPA) 
tournament registration.
o $6 of each entry fee goes towards the cash prize. 
• Cash prize is a minimum of $100. $6 from each entry fee will be added to the cash prize amount. 
For example, if 20 entry fees are collected, $120 will be added to the cash prize for a total of $220.
• Players will get one (1) chance to play each pinball machine. There are six (6) machines.
• The Tournament Director will activate each game by inserting money into the machine. 
• All scores will be recorded by the League Director. 
• Score from each game will be combined for total overall score. 
• The top three highest combined scores will receive a prize. 
• Prizes will be awarded as follows.
o Top combined score will receive 60% of the cash prize and a translite (approximate value 
$100). 
o Second highest combined score will be awarded 30% of the total cash prize and 
promotional bag (approximate value $25). 
o Third highest combined score will be awarded 10% of the cash prize and a promotional bag 
approximately value $25). 
• In the event of a tie, the players will play a sudden death match on machine selected by 
Tournament Director the day of tournament. The highest score will be awarded the position. 
Participation in this tournament is an agreement to abide by the rules of the tournament event. 
GEM Amusements LLC has the right to change, cancel or alter this tournament at any time without prior 
notice. Typographical and other errors are subject to correction. Void where prohibited by law. Awarded 
prizes are based on availability.
The decision of GEM Amusements LLC regarding the selection of winners and all other aspects of the 
contest shall be final and binding in all respects. 
Winner must be 18 years of age or older. To claim a prize, the winner must present a valid, governmentissued photo ID and permit a photocopy be made of ID provided. 
No substitution of a prize by the winner will be permitted unless otherwise specifically stated in these 
Official Rules. If it becomes necessary to substitute a prize due to unavailability of the prize originally 
intended, a prize of equal or greater value will be awarded at the discretion of GEM Amusements LLC. 
The winner’s entry and acceptance of any prize constitutes permission for GEM Amusements LLC to use 
the winner’s name, photograph, likeness, statements, biographical information, voice, and address (city 
and state), in all forms of media, in perpetuity, without notice or further compensation.
Prizes are not transferable. All federal, state, and local taxes, if all expenses related to the receipt and use 
of the prize are the sole responsibility of the winner. By participating, each contest entrant agrees to these 
Official Rules. Winners are required to release, discharge, and hold GEM Amusements LLC, its parent 
and affiliated companies, and their respective directors, officers, employees, and agents, harmless from all 
liabilities, claims or damages arising from participation in this contest and the acceptance, use, misuse or 
possession of the prize. 
Any dispute or situation not covered by the official rules will be resolved by GEM Amusements LLC 
management in a manner deemed by them to be the fairest to all concerned, and that decision shall be final 
and binding on all participants. In addition, GEM Amusements LLC reserves the right to void any entry, 
and/or to change, cancel or modify this promotion at any time.
By entering this tournament, entrants agree to abide by all terms of the official rules. Must be present to win

tournament_name: North End Pub Target Matchplay Series
details: The 4th Thursday of most months we will have either a Timed or Target Matchplay tournament! The tournament will start at 8:30 PM on the scheduled dates. Anyone is welcome to play, no entry fee, just need quarters for coin drop!

tournament_name: RLM Amusements Weekly Pinball Tournament
details:
RLM Amusements hosts a Max Matchplay pinball tournament every Thursday night! The tournament is open to all ages and all skill levels. The entry fee is $10 and all the games are on free play. The doors open at 5pm for practice and the tournament starts at 7pm. Top 8/12/16 players (depending on how many people show up) face off in the finals. We stream our tournaments on Twitch at https://twitch.tv/rlmamusements. Feel free to bring any food or drinks you may want. We have a refrigerator, freezer and microwave available.

RLM Amusements is located at 4318 Plainfield Ave NE Suite K Grand Rapids, MI 49525. We are in the back of the building directly behind H&R Block. Plenty of off street parking available. Hope to see you here!

tournament_name: Pinball Super League: Stern Army Enterrium Monthly
details:
Players of all skill levels are EXTREMELY welcome! $5 entry, $4 to prize pool, $1 to IFPA fees. Prize raffles! Event info can be found by going to next.matchplay.events on your phone and searching Enterrium during the tourney. Four rounds of balanced matchplay on 25-30 pins at Enterrium for qualifying. 7/5/3/1 scoring. Top 16 players qualify for playoffs as long as there are at least 32 players, otherwise top 8. Anyone tied at the 16th place cut line will play a single ball tiebreaker on a random classic pin. All other ties will be broken automatically in matchplay. Playoffs consist of groups of 4 playing a single randomly chosen game, top 2 in each game advance until only 4 players remain. Those 4 players will play a single 4 player game to determine final finishing positions. High seed in each group gets to go last. There is no game selection in any rounds of playoffs due to time constraints at the location.
Payouts for top 8:
5th-8th: $10
4th: 10% of prize pot
3rd: 20% of prize pot and a $10 Enterrium game card
2nd: 30% of prize pot and a $20 Enterrium game card
1st: 40% of prize pot and a $30 Enterrium game card
Format and arena list are subject to change at TD discretion. TD rulings and format decisions are final. Arguing rulings/formats with event TDs may result in a yellow card. IFPA/PAPA pinball rules are generally followed, but TDs reserve the right to differ from these rulings. Up to date rules can be found here:
https://www.ifpapinball.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/PAPA_IFPA-Complete-Competition-Rules-2021.04.06.pdf
Conduct rules can be found here:
http://sundaybest.kittensandwich.com/Chicagoland-Code-of-Conduct/

tournament_name: Flip Well Pinball League
details:
Get some regular play in with our seasonal Flip Well league. Games take place on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday of each month, with a Finals the first Wednesday of the month following the sixth session. At just a $5 entry fee per season plus coin drops, it’s the cheapest date night in town!

6pm Start time every 2nd and 4th Wednesday of the month

4 games in 4 player groups per night

Finals will be top 16 - 4 player groups with 4,2,1,0 scoring

Pinball Wizard's Palace @ One Well Brewing
55 Pins on the floor all set $.75 per game

tournament_name: IFPA Womens North American Championship
details: The winner (or runner-up if the winner is unavailable) of each Women's State/Province/District Pinball Championship will be invited to compete in the IFPA's Women's North American Championship. Format is a head-to-head single elimination best-of-7 bracket. $20 entry fee. Additional satellite events (both women's and open) will be held throughout the weekend.

tournament_name: IFPA Womens World Championship
details: The top 32 ranked women pinball players will battle in the Women's World Championship. The top 16 highest ranking women based on women's tournaments and the top 16 highest ranking women based on open tournaments will be invited to compete. Qualifying will be 8 rounds of 3 games with 7-5-3-1 scoring. The top 16 players will move onto the finals, which will be a head-to-head single elimination best-of-seven bracket. The winner will be crowned the Women's World Pinball Champion.
